page.title: 02MERSLEY FARMS, NEWCHURCH
page.content: The farming year starts in the{Autumn} The fields are ploughed and those crops that grow through the{winter}are planted. These are: garlic, carrots, onions and calabrese. After the {winter,}as spring starts, in{February} we plough and fertilise more land and plant potatoes and more carrots. Most of our early crops are covered with plastic to make them earlier. The months of {March}to{October}are the busiest on the farm. Asparagus, carrots and potatoes are harvested in {May,}onions in{June,}garlic in{July,} and sweet corn from{July,}until October. { The other crop on the farm is peat, dug from the marshes below the Church. People use this to put on their gardens to improve the soil. This is dug in the summer and dried.
